Key Match Events: Kai Havertz scored the opening goal for Germany in the 55th minute after being offside in the 43rd minute.
Pascal Gro√ü scored the winning goal in the 89th minute with a long-range shot.
Manuel Neuer made crucial saves but also made an error leading to Greece's goal by Giorgos Masouras.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann confirmed his squad with Manuel Neuer as the first-choice goalkeeper despite injuries.
Nagelsmann emphasized the need for improvement after a lackluster first half performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany's Toni Kroos acknowledged the team's mistakes but highlighted their better focus in the second half.
Coach Nagelsmann expressed relief at the win and mentioned the team's preparation for Scotland's opener.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was Germany's last tune-up before the Euro 2024 start, with high expectations.
The attendance was 45,488 fans supporting the team.
